titlepage.titleproper: Register of the Sergeĭ Dmitrievich Botkin Papers, 1917-1935
titlepage.publisher:
Hoover Institution Archives
Stanford University
Stanford, California
titlepage.p: © 1997 Hoover Institution Archives. All rights reserved.

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.abstract: Memoirs, correspondence, reports, memoranda, interview summaries, notes, and printed matter, relating to Russian emigres in Berlin, elsewhere in Germany, and in other European countries, after the Russian Revolution; and to the claim of one Anastasiia Nikolaevna Chaikovskaia to be Grand Duchess Anastasia of Russia.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Sergeĭ Dmitrievich Botkin Papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1930.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog Socrates at http://library.stanford.edu/webcat. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in Socrates is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

controlaccess.head: Access Points
controlaccess.persname: Anastasiia Nikolaevna, Grand Duchess of Russia
controlaccess.subject: Refugees.
Russians--Germany

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Memoirs, correspondence, reports, memoranda, interview summaries, notes, and printed matter, relating to Russian emigres in Berlin, elsewhere in Germany, and in other European countries, after the Russian Revolution; and to the claim of one Anastasiia Nikolaevna Chaikovskaia to be Grand Duchess Anastasia of Russia.
Handwritten copy of S. Botkine's reminiscences

did.unittitle: Handwritten copy of S. Botkine's reminiscences

scopecontent.p: Reports from former Russian diplomatic representatives in various countries to the Senior Diplomatic Representative in Paris. Reports to Senior Diplomatic Representative in Paris from:
Correspondence, memoranda, reports, printed matter and published materials. Arranged alphabetically by subject

did.unittitle: Bulletin de la Societe Russe de la Croix Rouge, 1921-1922
General, printed matter relating to economic and political questions submitted to:
Conference of Genoa and League of Nations, 1921-1922
Organizatsiia Zashchity Interesov Russkikh Bezhentsev v Germanii
Soiuz Rossiiskikh Torgovo-Promyshlennykh i Finansovykh Deiatelei v Germanii, 1923-1924
Rossiiskii Zemsko-Gorodskoi Komitet Pomoshchi Rossiiskim Grazhdanam Zagranitsei, 1922-1929

scopecontent.p: Correspondence, memoranda, notes, reports, writings, printed matter and clippings relating to the investigation of allegations by A. N. Chaikovskii claiming to be Grand Duchess Anastasia Romanoff. Arranged by last names of individuals and by subject

did.unittitle: General, background information and explanatory notes
Andrew, Grand Duke, correspondence with Baron Osten-Sacken, 1927
Dassel, Feliz, articles in the German press, 1927
Koehler, Egon, letter to Mrs. Serge Botkine, March 3, 1926
Lawsuits in the German press relating to the A. N. Chaikovskii case
Doctors and nurses having cared for A. N. Chaikovskii, 1926-1927
Manuscript of a book on A. N. Chaikovskii
Notes regarding A. N. Chaikovskii, n.d.
Zahle, H., correspondence with Baron Osten-Sacken, 192
